thread.title: Phillipsburg's Noah Long is Mr. Anywhere for the boys soccer team
thread.title_full: Phillipsburg's Noah Long is Mr. Anywhere for the boys soccer team

title: Phillipsburg's Noah Long is Mr. Anywhere for the boys soccer team
text:
Phillipsburg High School junior Noah Long has “For” next to his name on the boys soccer roster, labeling him a forward. 
Actually, Long might want to have “Any” as this three-letter designation. As in, anywhere. 
The junior could be spotted at defensive midfielder and forward during the Stateliners’ 2-1 victory over Vernon in the Hunterdon/Warren/Sussex quarterfinals on Saturday. 
“Noah can play almost anywhere on the field,” said Phillipsburg coach Evan Weller, whose team advances to play second-seeded Newton on Oct. 24. “He’s an exceptional player. It depends on where we need him to play in any particular game. He steps up and does whatever we ask him to do.” 
RELATED : Phillipsburg boys soccer eliminates H/W/S tournament drama, well almost 
Long’s versatility is especially impressive considering he had exclusively appeared in Phillipsburg’s back line prior to this fall. 
He did, however, quickly acclimate to his expanded role, scoring four goals in P’burg’s first game of the season (a 5-0 shutout of Delaware Valley). 
Long had to settle for an assist on Saturday, but almost had a sensational goal when he lofted a shot, from practically the parking lot, midway through the first half only to be denied by the crossbar. 
The junior indicated that he doesn’t have a preference between playing up top or assisting the Stateliners’ defense. 
“I’ll do what I can do with wherever I am, really,” Long said. 
Now, if only there was a way to easily sum up his multifaceted style on the ’Liners roster.
